title: Independence National Historical Park: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar           Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 26 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Independence National Historical Park Exhibit:  100 Years of the National Park Service      Time: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM Location: Liberty Bell Center, 6th and Market Streets Fees: FREE     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 08/05/2016 to 12/31/2016 Learn about America's national parks and get the special National Park Service Centennial passport stamp. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Family Fun: National Park Fun Zone      Time: 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM Location: Inside the Liberty Bell Center, 6th Street just south of Market Street Fees: FREE     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Learn about the Liberty Bell - and other national parks - in the Fun Zone. View Details      Independence National Historical Park For Kids: Barnacles and Bullets      Time: 1:00 PM to 1:15 PM,4:00 PM to 4:15 PM Location: New Hall Military Museum, Chestnut Street, between 3rd and 4th Streets Fees: FREE     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 06/25/2016 to 09/05/2016 Find out what it would have been like to serve in the Continental Army or Navy during the American Revolution during this hands-on program. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Gallery Tour:  Orientation Tour to the Portrait Gallery      Time: 11:30 AM to 11:45 AM,12:30 PM to 12:45 PM,1:30 PM to 1:45 PM,2:30 PM to 2:45 PM,3:30 PM to 3:45 PM,4:30 PM to 4:45 PM Location: Second Bank of the U.S., Chestnut Street between 4th and 5th Sts. Fees: FREE     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 06/25/2016 to 09/05/2016 See original portraits of the Founding Fathers. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Walking Tour: Dr. Franklin's Philadelphia      Time: 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM Location: Meet at the entrance to the Benjamin Franklin Museum, Franklin Court, between Market and Chestnut Streets and 3rd and 4th Streets Fees: FREE     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 06/25/2016 to 09/04/2016 Get to know this multifaceted founding father in a one hour walking tour through Franklin's Philadelphia.  View Details      Independence National Historical Park Walking Tour: In the Paths of the Founders      Time: 2:30 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Meet in the Signers Garden, corner of 5th and Chestnut Streets Fees: FREE     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Join a park ranger for this orientation walking tour of Independence National Historical Park. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Walking Tour: Twilight Tour      Time: 6:00 PM to 7:15 PM Location: Begins at the Independence Visitor Center, 6th and Market Streets Fees: FREE     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Join a volunteer guide from the Friends of Independence for a walking tour through the park. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Ranger Program: Forging Justice: The Women's Liberty Bell      Time: 11:00 AM to 11:15 AM Location: Inside the Liberty Bell Center, 6th Street just south of Market Street Fees: FREE     Thursday, August 18, 2016 Hear the story of the women who worked to extend voting rights to women with their Women's Liberty Bell. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Ranger Program: Ladies of Liberty, Justice, and Equality      Time: 12:00 PM to 12:30 PM Location: Independence Visitor Center, corner of 6th and Market Streets Fees: FREE     Thursday, August 18, 2016 Join a park ranger for a 30-minute slide program and hear inspiring stories of women and their crusades for women's rights. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Walking Tour: The Women's American Revolution      Time: 2:30 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Signer's Garden, corner of 5th and Chestnut Streets Fees: FREE     Thursday, August 18, 2016 Follow in the footsteps of the women who used Independence Square to fight their own revolution. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Dinner and Tour: Independence After Hours      Time: 5:30 PM to 8:30 PM Location: Program begins at the Independence Visitor Center, 6th and Market Streets Fees: $85 Adults; $80 Seniors, Students and Military; $55 Kids 12 & under.      Friday, August 19, 2016 Enjoy a three course meal at City Tavern and a chance to "sneak" into Independence Hall after hours. View Details      Independence National Historical Park For Kids: Military Muster      Time: 2:00 PM to 2:30 PM,3:00 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Signers Garden, corner of 5th and Chestnut Streets Fees: FREE     Friday, August 19, 2016 Learn marching and musket etiquette in this fun and spirited muster for kids. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Living History:  Colonial Stations      Time: 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM Location: Various locations in the park Fees: FREE     Friday, August 19, 2016 Famous and not-so-famous historical figures will captivate you with their past.   View Details      Independence National Historical Park Living History: Reading of the Declaration      Time: 3:45 PM to 4:00 PM Location: Barry Statue on Independence Square, between 5th and 6th Streets and Chestnut and Walnut Streets Fees: FREE     Friday, August 19, 2016 Come join the Once Upon a Nation History Makers as they read from select passages of the Declaration of Independence.  View Details      Independence National Historical Park Storytelling: Once Upon a Nation      Time: 11:00 AM to 4:00 PM Location: At storytelling benches in various locations in and around Independence Park Fees: FREE     Friday, August 19, 2016 Stop by all 13 Once Upon a Nation storytelling benches to hear captivating tales from Philadelphia's past. View Details      Independence National Historical Park For Kids: Officer's Candidate School      Time: 10:30 AM to 3:00 PM Location: Independence Mall, between Market and Arch Sts. and 5th and 6th Sts. Fees: FREE     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Kids, enroll and a receive a special National Park Service Centennial assignment that will require you to solve problems and prove your worth to the Continental Army. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Founders Day Celebration: Happy 100th Birthday National Park Service!      Time: 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM Location: Independence Mall, between Market & Arch Sts. and 5th and 6th Sts. Fees: FREE     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Join us as we celebrate the 100th Birthday of the National Park Service with ceremony, games, special ranger programs, free admission to the Benjamin Franklin Museum, and, of course, birthday cake!  View Details      Independence National Historical Park Founders Day Family Fun: Centennial Quizzo      Time: 10:30 AM to 4:30 PM Location: Benjamin Franklin Museum, in Franklin Court Fees: FREE     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Test your knowledge of America's National Parks and win prizes. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Founders Day Picnic      Time: 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM Location: Independence Mall, between Market & Arch Sts. and 5th & 6th Sts. Fees: FREE     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Celebrate the National Park Service's 100th Birthday with a picnic on Independence Mall. Enjoy live music, games, and more. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Founders Day Slide Program: "The American Adventure is a Continuing Process: 100 Years of the NPS and its Role in Philadelphia"      Time: 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM Location: Independence Visitor Center Theater, corner of 6th and Market Streets Fees: FREE     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Discover the crucial role the National Park Service continues to play in the preservation of the Birthplace of the United States. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Founders Day Slide Program: "The American Adventure is a Continuing Process: 100 Years of the NPS and its Role in Philadelphia"      Time: 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM Location: Independence Visitor Center Theater, corner of 6th and Market Streets Fees: FREE     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Discover the crucial role the National Park Service continues to play in the preservation of the Birthplace of the United States. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Founders Day Walking Tour: "Then and Now, A History of Independence NHP and the National Park Service"      Time: 2:30 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Signers Garden, SE corner of 5th and Chestnut Streets Fees: FREE     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Join a ranger for a walk around Independence National Historical Park and hear the saga of its creation as one of America's premier national historical parks. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Founders Day Walking Tour: "Then and Now, A History of Independence NHP and the National Park Service"      Time: 10:30 AM to 11:30 AM Location: Independence Visitor Center, between Market and Arch Streets and 5th and 6th Streets Fees: FREE     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Join a ranger for a walk around Independence National Historical Park and hear the saga of its creation as one of America's premier national historical parks. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Family Fun: Franklin Court Centennial Zone      Time: 9:00 AM to 7:00 PM Location: Franklin Court courtyard, between Market & Chestnut Sts, and 3rd & 4th Sts. Fees: FREE     Friday, August 26, 2016 Play games, win prizes and find out about the 100 year history of your National Park Service. View Details      Independence National Historical Park For Kids: Officer's Candidate School      Time: 8:30 AM to 2:00 PM Location: Independence Visitor Center, corner of 6th and Market Streets Fees: FREE     Friday, August 26, 2016 Kids, enroll and receive a special NPS Centennial assignment that will require you to solve problems and prove your worth to the Continental Army. View Details      Independence National Historical Park Walking Tour: The British Occupation of Philadelphia      Time: 3:00 PM to 4:00 PM Location: Franklin Court Courtyard, between Market and Chestnut Streets, and 3rd and 4th Streets Fees: FREE     Saturday, September 10, 2016 Learn about the British occupation of Philadelphia during the Revolutionary War - and the difficult choices that people had to make - on this walking tour.
